stories.original_headline: Scientists discover protein that rejuvenates aging brain cells
stories.original_summary: A newly identified protein may hold the key to rejuvenating aging brain cells. stories.fantasy_headline: Alchemists Brew Elixir to Restore Elder Minds!
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Alchemists' Guild has unearthed a potent new essence, a hidden ingredient to mend the fading wits of the elderly. They say this elixir can rekindle the mind's inner glow, restoring forgotten memories and sharp thoughts. It promises a brighter age for our wisest elders.

stories.original_headline: Europe’s “untouched” wilderness was shaped by Neanderthals and hunter-gatherers
stories.original_summary: Long before agriculture, humans were transforming Europe’s wild landscapes. stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Clans Tended Wilderness Before Plows!
stories.fantasy_story: Long before our settled kingdoms, the Old Continent's wild lands were not untouched. Ancient clans of skilled foragers, through their hunts and hearth fires, subtly reshaped the deep forests and sprawling grasslands. They managed the great beasts, unknowingly changing the very nature of the land for generations.
